TopicTitle: Looking for a simple mod for production of Kerbals [solved... I guess]

Articles.Content:
I have been looking for this, but it seems like growing the population of your colonies without sending busfulls of Kerbals every so often is locked away behind a lot of additional parts from a mod that relies on food/water/air life support mods, both civilian population and MKS kolonization. I found an old mod that did kind of what I needed, but it was outdated. Is there any up to date, patch based mod that allows for generating new Kerbals in-situ?

EDIT: this is the one that I talked about https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/191525-1122-moarkerbals-populate-your-colony-in-space-11299-prerelease-20-nov-2021/

EDIT2: I swear it was out of date when I checked earlier today. Whoops.

Edited April 3, 2022 by KarolOfGutovo

2 hours ago, KarolOfGutovo said:

I have been looking for this, but it seems like growing the population of your colonies without sending busfulls of Kerbals every so often is locked away behind a lot of additional parts from a mod that relies on food/water/air life support mods, both civilian population and MKS kolonization. I found an old mod that did kind of what I needed, but it was outdated. Is there any up to date, patch based mod that allows for generating new Kerbals in-situ?

EDIT: this is the one that I talked about https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/191525-1122-moarkerbals-populate-your-colony-in-space-11299-prerelease-20-nov-2021/

EDIT2: I swear it was out of date when I checked earlier today. Whoops.

Another way to get Kerbals is to take every rescue contract, no matter how far away.  I typically "shanghai" the ones that are far from Kerbin (Jool especially as I always need kerbals there) directly into a job and don't return them to Kerbin.  But if the craft is supposed to be returned I'll return it to Kerbin typically, but not always.  When I do this I will MOD-F12 and "complete" the contract.  I know.  Very cheaty.  But in my head they are so grateful for being rescued that they want to get to work right away, lol

1 hour ago, darthgently said:

Another way to get Kerbals is to take every rescue contract, no matter how far away.  I typically "shanghai" the ones that are far from Kerbin (Jool especially as I always need kerbals there) directly into a job and don't return them to Kerbin.  But if the craft is supposed to be returned I'll return it to Kerbin typically, but not always.  When I do this I will MOD-F12 and "complete" the contract.  I know.  Very cheaty.  But in my head they are so grateful for being rescued that they want to get to work right away, lol

Harvesting stranded Kerbals would be a very funny way to grow a colony in a different star system, maybe I will just meddle a bit with contract manager to make those contracts more common.

3 minutes ago, KarolOfGutovo said:

Harvesting stranded Kerbals would be a very funny way to grow a colony in a different star system, maybe I will just meddle a bit with contract manager to make those contracts more common.

 

 

Point taken.  But I was assuming that the pattern of rescuee locations being mostly in SOIs one already has a presence in staying in place for KSP2 and other stars.   So once you got a craft to the other star you'd start seeing rescue contracts around that star.  I really hope that KSP2 gives rescuees the experience level commensurate with having somehow gotten to that location.  That is a rescuee around Jool should have at least 5 stars, maybe minus one for requiring rescue, lol

I am prepping the repo for the next update. The core version comes without parts and uses stock parts (adds functionality not parts (overloads functionality)) so very minor resource impact.

On 4/3/2022 at 11:42 AM, darthgently said:

 I really hope that KSP2 gives rescuees the experience level commensurate with having somehow gotten to that location.  That is a rescuee around Jool should have at least 5 stars, maybe minus one for requiring rescue, lol

Well, tourists don't get experience, and we have no reason to believe these Kerbals have learned anything from their mistakes.
